column1: TA3.38;The Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's extraction capacity is able to extract the ores
column2: minerals or concentrates needed to produce at least 10% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column3: to the extent that the Union’s reserves allow for this;TA4.1;+;The implementation of TA3.38 is likely to have a positive impact on TA4.1
column4: as a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials can support the production of sustainable biomethane
column5: which is a key component of the EU's energy strategy.;The connection between these two targets is based on the fact that critical raw materials are essential for the production of various energy technologies

column1: TA3.40;Member States shall meet the target of 77% by weight for the separate collection for recycling of waste single-use plastic beverage bottles by 2025 and 90% by 2029;TA4.14;+;The implementation of TA3.40 can have a positive impact on TA4.14
column2: as increasing the collection and recycling of plastic waste can lead to a reduction in marine litter and support the development of sustainable and renewable fuels for the maritime sector.;This connection is based on the idea that reducing plastic waste and increasing recycling rates can contribute to a cleaner and more sustainable environment
column3: which is essential for the development of sustainable fuels.

column1: TA3.41;From 2019

column1: TA3.44;From 15 August 2018

column2: the preparing for re-use and recycling of municipal waste shall be increased to a minimum of 55% by weight (60% by 2030

column1: TA4.10;EU fisheries are encouraged to continue the positive trend
column2: as observed for the period 2009-2019
column3: towards reducing fuel intensity by reducing the fossil-fuel consumption per kg of landed product for at least an additional 15% for the period 2019-2030;TA3.47;+;The implementation of TA4.10 can have a positive impact on TA3.47
column4: as reducing fuel intensity in fisheries can lead to a reduction in waste and support the development of sustainable and renewable fuels for the transportation sector.;This connection is based on the idea that reducing fuel consumption can contribute to a cleaner and more sustainable environment

column1: TA4.16;From 1 January 2020

column6: which is essential for the development of sustainable fuels.
